summary: User unable to run Temporal TypeScript SDK in Meteor 2.7.3 environment due to AsyncLocalStorage conflicts with Meteor's fiber-based architecture, causing crashes when calling Connection.connect().
userImpact: Users cannot use Temporal TypeScript SDK within Meteor 2.7.3 applications due to environment incompatibility.
rootCause: Meteor uses fibers which conflict with AsyncLocalStorage's internal async_hooks implementation, causing a Symbol(kResourceStore) property access error during promise initialization.
proposedFix: Degrade client capabilities when AsyncLocalStorage cannot be accessed, or allow SDK to run without AsyncLocalStorage dependency.
resolutionDetails: Issue was closed by user agreement after exploration; appears to be an environment-specific limitation rather than SDK bug.
keyQuote: We could look into degrading the client capabilities when AsyncLocalStorage cannot be accessed.
